citation.article-title: Staphylococcus succinus subsp. casei subsp. nov., a dominant isolate from a surface ripened cheese.

p.s: Description of Staphylococcus succinus subsp. casei subsp. nov.
Staphylococcus succinus subsp. casei (ca´se.i. L. gen. n. casei of cheese, named because the organism was isolated from cheese)
Cells are Gram-positive, spherical (diameter 1.1 to 2.0 μm), aerobic, non-motile, and occur singly, in pairs or in irregular clumps.
Colonies after 2 d on PC skim milk agar plates at 32 °C are raised with an elevated centre, opaque white, rough and crenated, measuring 4–6 mm in diameter.
The strain is able to grow aerobically in the presence of 15% NaCl.

Strain SB72T reduces nitrate to nitrite, forms acid from D-mannose and D-melezitose, ferments adenosine, 2’-deoxyadenosine, inosine, thymidine-5’-monophosphate, D-melibiose, gentiobiose, D-sorbitol, 2,3-butanediol, and a-keto valeric acid, but not D-alanine.
Principal membrane fatty acids are the saturated, odd-numbered, branched-chain fatty acids 15:0 iso, 15:0 anteiso, 17:0 iso, and 17:0 anteiso.
It contains tuberculostearic acid (TBSA 10Me18:0) which is reported to be characteristic for the species taphylococcus succinus (LAMBERT et al., 1998).
The peptidoglycan structure of strain SB72T consists of L-Lys-Gly4, Ser. Strain SB72T is the type strain (DSM 15096, CIP no. pending).
The description of the strain corresponds to the description of the subspecies.
